We had a thrilling boat ride along 55 kilometres of the mighty Ord River as part of our recent 17-day land tour of the Kimberley with APT. At times the boat was travelling at high speeds with its V8 outboard motors while at other times it travelled slowly along lush tropical tributaries. We saw crocodiles, bats and various types of birds. It was a wonderful experience.

Why would you book with APT and not directly with Holland America?

Hi Manda, we are proud to partner with Holland America Line on our tours in Canada and Alaska. When you book with APT, our guests will have a dedicated APT cruise liaison and an APT Tour Director will be travelling with you, ensuring that everything runs smoothly. You will then join an Alaskan land journey after you disembark your cruise, which is APT run and directed with all the signature experiences and luxury accommodations APT is known for.

So many beautiful memories of the Kimberley!! One of the many memories is on the first day of our tour, we stopped in the middle of nowhere as it was “time for a cuppa”. Our awesome driver/ guide Peter , pulled up the side of the truck, brought out some chairs and a table, put a tablecloth on it, brought out some little cakes and biscuits, hot tea and coffee. We were blown away!! Even in one of our big hikes, he carried a thermos, cups, tea & coffee and biscuits in his backpack - amazing! I joked with him a few times about how I was sure he could even make us scones with jam and cream because he was awesome. I couldn’t believe it when we came back from a hike to one of the beautiful APT Wilderness Lodges and Pete had organised them to make scones with jam and cream for our afternoon tea. I was absolutely delighted (and a little embarrassed as I had really only been joking with him). This story is just an example of how ALL the APT guides go the extra mile to keep their tour group happy. Love you APT.

Such a special memory Sandy!
Thankyou so much for sharing with us
Scones with jam and cream make for the perfect afternoon tea.

Our Canada and Alaska tour was our first of many with APT. We were shocked that several people from our tour chose not to get up to see this stunning sunrise. Every day was unforgettable and I can highly recommend it.

We have so many awesome memories of our many tours we have done with APT that it is really difficult to choose just one!! We have special memories of Canada & Alaska, Africa, Vietnam & Cambodia, New Zealand, the beautiful Norwegian coast on the Island Sky followed by the Best of the Baltics, China, Japan, Kimberley Kakadu & Arnhem Land and our latest Kimberley Cruise!! All of them were absolutely amazing! I have picked a photo from our latest Kimberley Cruise onboard the beautiful Caledonian Sky - my favourite day was our visit to Montgomery Reef in the Zodiacs... stunning. I loved it when our zodiac driver nosed the zodiac into the gushing and powerful water! I know the photo won't do the feeling of being there watching this amazing natural phenomenon justice, but here it is:

Are there any barriers as to age and fitness?

Hi Elizabeth,
Our Kimberley tours visit remote areas and feature activities with varying degrees of difficulty. A good level of fitness is essential for you to undertake walks in hot conditions and over terrain with uneven and slippery surfaces.

My wife and I cruised from Budapest to Amsterdam on the MS AmaReina in 2014. The cruise was fantastic and APT’s service was absolutely tops. APT provides some great options for excursions. One of the most enjoyable and memorable excursions we had was a leisurely guided 30+ kilometre pushbike ride alongside the Danube River in Germany. During the ride, we stopped at several picturesque and historic towns and villages. It was magical.
